page.title: 12From Mumbles to Abercregan
page.content: Our class went on a field studies week to Abercregan.There is a great difference between Mumbles and Abercregan.The first thing we noticed was that there was no castle,park or shop.There was a small Post Office,but we were disappointed as it sold no sweets.There was no beach as we were away from the sea and no boats or promenade.Sixty out of every hundred people in the area were unemployed. During the week we went on long walks of between five and ten miles.While we were on the walks we saw farms in use and in ruins,also coal tips and we walked through conifer forests.We tested soil and air temperature,soil drainage and acidity,and windspeed. At night we slept in bunks in dormitories.By Carlo Crooks.
